item.title: Getting started
item.description: Overview Writing scripts and attaching them to nodes and other objects is how you build behavior and game mechanics into your game. For example, a Sprite2D node automatically displays an image, but to move it across the screen, you’ll add a script that tells it how fast, in what direction, and so on. You can think of it as the coding version of using the Inspector - GDScript knows all about Godot nodes and how to access them, plus it allows you to change them dynamically.
